barrier.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do
barrier.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
Problems with childcare remain the biggest barrier to women succeeding at work.
barrier.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a type of fence or gate that prevents people from moving in a particular direction
barrier.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
barrier.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a physical object that keeps two areas, people etc apart
barrier.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
barrier.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The aim was to remove trade barriers and open up free markets.
Living in China was hard for me at first because of the language barrier.
Sport is a sure way to break down racial barriers.
The Internet allows people of all ages to interact without the usual social barriers.
Most of the technical barriers have been solved.
They were committed to breaking down the artificial barriers to womenâ€™s achievement.
Regulatory barriers have been an obstacle to international co-operation between police forces.
This is one of many bureaucratic barriers preventing the unemployed from claiming benefit.
Institutional barriers limit what can be achieved.
Most companies have broken down the old barriers of status among the workers.
Music has the great advantage of crossing cultural barriers.
Will this remove the barriers to change?
There are still many more barriers that need to be overcome.
We should be reducing barriers to imports from poor countries.
Some kids have erected emotional barriers that stop them from learning.
Uniforms are one of the things that create barriers.
